text: Clausthal-Zellerfeld is a town in Lower Saxony, Germany. Its population is around 15,000. The towns of Clausthal and Zellerfeld joined to form Clausthal- Zellerfeld. Mining was done in the city from the 16th century. It stopped in 1930, as there was nothing left to mine. == References ==
title: Clausthal-Zellerfeld
